I am a theorist who loves to write code, with broad mathematical and scientific training. I am a fifth-year Computer Science PhD candidate at Cornell, advised by Joe Halpern.

My PhD work has focused primarily on a class of graphical models I discovered called Probabilistic Dependency Graphs (PDGs), which subsumes traditional graphical models, as well as many machine leraning models. Critically, PDGs can contain inconsistent probabilistic information, and that degree of inconsistency turns out to be quite important.
